channel.title: Rate My Website (www.sylvion.com)
channel.description:
Hey i wanted use to rate my site and give me comments and constructive critism.
If this is classed as advertising in your oppinion, i will post the files and remove the link.
Some of the features:
[ul][li]Secksi colour changing banner when you go to other catagories[/li] [li]Nice plain fixed background[/li] [li]Easy editable affliates on side bar[/li][/ul]
Here is a screenshot:
[img]http://www.sylvion.com/images/siteimage.png[/img]
So please post and tell me what to add to it :)
By the way i am not advertising i'm just showing off my site.
~Zandia

item.title: Rate My Website (www.sylvion.com)
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:11, topic:139585”][quote author=kloplop321 link=topic=191556.msg1726721#msg1726721 date=1188781087]
nah, background color is set inside of flash, unless you want to manually change it
[/quote]

Is this normal flash or fireworks? If it’s flash 8 then I need to get into that![/quote]
Yah I use flash 8(legaly(end educational version))

xxlegitxx:

I’m pretty sure Flash 8 can do anything Fireworks can do. Like I said, all you need to do is set the embedded flash file to the width of the browser and it is the whole page.

That would be false. Flash does the effects at run time, therefore it is limited to its strength, quality, and how many effects.
Flash doesn’t have a “Convert to alpha” or do the finding edges thing
If you want a flash background you would need to have it in its own DIV layer at the lowest Z and have the flash at 100% by 100% and the div at 100% by 100% at absolute 0,0(this is just an idea, I haven’t personally tested it or seen it happen)

Read full topic

item.title: Rate My Website (www.sylvion.com)
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I’m pretty sure Flash 8 can do anything Fireworks can do. Like I said, all you need to do is set the embedded flash file to the width of the browser and it is the whole page.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate My Website (www.sylvion.com)
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Your horribly misunderstanding me.

I just wanted to know if you can make a whole web site in the program Flash 8. Or if there was a different Macromedia program like fireworks that you can make a flash web site.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate My Website (www.sylvion.com)
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:10, topic:139585”]did u really just say Sun Microsoft Systems?!

o god this is a dark day for us all.[/quote]

I’m sure he just missed the ‘s’ key after ‘Sun Micro’ and hit the ‘soft s’ key instead.

goatee:

Is this normal flash or fireworks? If it’s flash 8 then I need to get into that!

? If you make the flash embed the size of the browser, you should be able to set a layer as the background within the flash file. Or am I misunderstanding you?

Zandia:
Change the background attribute in the body selector from

background-image: url(img/bg.jpg); background-attachment: fixed;

to

background:url(img/bg.jpg) no-repeat;

That’s a quick fix. A fixed bg is no good; it lags FF2 to my knowledge. The more thorough fix would be to find a better background file. 144KB? Come on, that’s ridiculous. At the very least, make it be able to repeat correctly. At best, find a small image (1-2KB) that can repeat indefinitely.

The top-left header image looks pretty crappy; I’m sure you can do better. The header gradient is blocky, as is the border.

It’s XHTML 1.0 Transitional. And change the footer to this:

© Copyright Zandia and SylvionSoft 2007 - <a href="http://validator.w3.org/check?url=referer">Valid XHTML 1.1 Transitional</a>, <a href="http://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/check/referer">Valid CSS 2</a> Powered

EDIT: And I agree with TestDummy. If you choose to go the XHTML route, at least don’t drag in HTML 4 relics. Quotes around urls (), self-close img/br/link tags, etc. I think most of the errors were caused by his unclosed br tags. And if you go XHTML, go FULL XHTML. Meaning you include an .htaccess file “addtype application/vnd.wap.xhtml+xml xhtml”. You put CDATA tags around style and script tags. All of that.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate My Website (www.sylvion.com)
item.dc:creator: @TestDummy TestDummy
item.description:
@TestDummy wrote:

I’ll admit validation isn’t everything, but if you’re going to say your pages are valid, at least make them so.
A couple of errors would be an honest mistake I guess, but 48?
http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sylvion.com%2Fdownloads%2F&charset=(detect+automatically)&doctype=Inline&group=0

As far as other things to point out, I personally think in terms of size, the background is excessive. 144KB just for that?

Read full topic

item.title: Rate My Website (www.sylvion.com)
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Somethings that don’t look good:
New logo is shit tbh.
Your forum banner is too small, you should try making it fit across the top entirely. Also the color of the banner doesn’t match the color scheme of SMF.
You have too much on your forums(as in boards). You only have like 10 members(if that?) and you got like 20 boards.

Read full topic
